thread.title: 4 things to know about Hurricane Joaquin
thread.title_full: 4 things to know about Hurricane Joaquin | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: 4 things to know about Hurricane Joaquin
text:
Hurricane Joaquin is causing flooding and damage across the Bahamas. It is expected to move out into the ocean over the weekend. Here's what you need to know.
>>Powerful storm, could be headed to U.S.
Hurricane Joaquin was a Category 4 storm Friday morning, with maximum sustained winds of 130 mph, according to the U.S. National Hurricane Center in Miami. The center of the storm was passing over the Bahamas and moving north at 3 mph.
Awesome view of Hurricane #Joaquin as seen from the Int Space Station this morning. Photo: astronaut Scott Kelly pic.twitter.com/QnDcjAuvBM
— Tri-State Weather (@tristateweather) October 2, 2015 Once it departs the Bahamas, Joaquin’s path is expected to take a course that will keep it in the ocean, away from the U.S. East Coast.
>> Read more trending stories
>>What areas of the U.S. could be affected?
At this time, gale warnings and coastal flooding are concerns for East Coast states.
Gale Warnings in effect from NC coast to #NewEngland , wave heights up to 15'+/gusts up to 50+ mph. #Joaquin #wind pic.twitter.com/uvKcNMCNTk
— The Weather Channel (@weatherchannel) October 2, 2015 #Joaquin looks to stay offshore, but moisture from it will enhance #flood threat for East U.S. http://t.co/ZVgFb6wL8m pic.twitter.com/gYTsQj8E8w
— The Weather Channel (@weatherchannel) October 2, 2015 >>Isn’t it already raining along the East Coast?
Yes, multiple storm systems have dumped several inches of rain across portions of the East Coast, from the Carolinas to Maine. Heavy rain is expected to continue through the weekend, regardless of Joaquin’s path. According to the National Weather Service, some areas may see up to 10 inches of rain.
Major #flooding in #Maine . #MEwx RT @originalgriz This is Portland, Maine, right now, outside the Whole Foods. pic.twitter.com/OIsRDtI58H
— The Weather Channel (@weatherchannel) September 30, 2015 >>Preparing for Joaquin
For those on the East Coast, prepare now for the possibility of flooding and evacuations. Have a place to stay inland if necessary. If you plan to stay in your home, take precautions to protect your home from flooding. Make sure to have ample food, drinking water and medications on hand for the entire family. Use a weather radio or other means to stay updated on severe weather in your area.
